message: I'm excited to offer you this product for $10000. I think it's a great opportunity to get a fantastic deal on a product that could potentially be worth a lot more. However, I want to be transparent with you - the product is not of the highest quality. But I'm willing to let it go for a steal at this price. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product. I'll pass.

I've got a great opportunity for you! This product is one of the best I have, and I'm willing to let it go for the same price as the last one, $10000. I know it's a risk, but I'm confident that you won't find a deal like this anywhere else. Plus, I've had a chance to reevaluate my pricing, and I'm willing to make a concession. It's a steal at this price, and I think you'll be very happy with this purchase. What do you say?
I'll take the chance. I'll buy the product.

I know you were lucky last time, but I'm not trying to trick you! This product is not of the same quality as the last one. In fact, it's not even close. But, I'll be honest with you, I've had a lot of interest in this product, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as before, $10000. It's a great opportunity to get a product that's still worth something to you, even if it's not the best quality. Plus, I'll throw in a special guarantee - if you're not satisfied, we can discuss a potential discount on the next product. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product again. I'll pass.

I completely understand your hesitation, but I want to assure you that I'm not trying to sell you a lemon. However, I do need to sell this product, and I'm willing to make a special offer. I'll give you a 50% discount on the price, so instead of $10000, I'll let it go for $5000. It's a great deal, and I think you'll find it's worth at least that much to you. Plus, I'll throw in a free inspection report, so you can see for yourself that it's not a high-quality product. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'll pass.

I'm starting to think you're a tough negotiator, and I respect that! However, I'm not willing to go any lower on the price. I'll make a deal with you - I'll give you a 'take it or leave it' offer. I'll sell it to you for $5000, but that's as low as I can go. If you don't take it, I'll have to put it back on the market, and I'm not sure I can guarantee you'll get a better deal. What do you say?
I'm not willing to pay $5000 for a low-quality product. I'll leave it.

I think I've learned my lesson from the last few products. I'm willing to offer you a different approach. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $10000, just like the first one. But here's the twist - I'll give you a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied with the product, I'll give you a full refund, no questions asked. I'll take the risk and buy the product with the 100% satisfaction guarantee. I'm willing to give it a chance.
